caption: cool pizza
Expected a bit of over hype and had slices that exceeded expectations at 1130 on a Monday morning
top 5
Best Slice in NYC
Smartly named, Best Pizza serves reliably delicious slices.
Absolutely one of the best !
Excellent thin crust pizza. Must try the white pie.
One of my favorite pizza joints in nyc
It's the best.
The Best no doubt

Worth the hype, truly the best. We wandered to Best Pizza on a bit of a hazy high whim and figured at the least we might get a decent slice of pizza and say we got to go to "that place on that vice pizza show". But seriously my expectations were tossed the second that steamy slice made it out the door with me. We tried a bit of a tour de slice and had one of everything, personally the stand out was the grandma slice (square pizza, perfectly crunchy za' with big ol' chunks of tomato and layered cheese just like your nona made), and the white pizza (ate too fast to get a picture - imagine a heavenly white slice, layered cheeses, caramelized onions that melt in your mouth, and an egg wash crust with sesame seeds). Pair this with a brew or beverage of choice and this place knows whats up.  Friendly and welcoming staff, delicious food made from fresh ingredients in a wood fired pizza oven. Add this to your must see when in NYC.
What else can I say about best pizza - it’s the best pizza. Beyond fresh, classic New York crust, really hits the spot fr.

Under new ownership? Pizza was really doughy and it was dense, dried out and so chewy my teeth were tired. I don’t know what to say as this was the absolute best slice when we came regularly years ago. I don’t have the heart to give under 3 stars as I’m hoping they were just have a super off day.
Solid pizza slice. I really like the grandma and pepperoni slices. They also do gluten free slices made-to-order which I’ve never seen at any other pizza place.
Phenomenal pizza. Absolutely incredible. White slice is light on cheese but has incredible dough, crisp, and onions and sesame seeds galore.  Regular slice is out of this world
Good old NYC slice, possibly my favorite.
Nice people, best staff service and clean place to grab a bite.
Great atmosphere with the best service ever. love the food and never get tired of it.
My kids has made a permanent day for pizza due to the great service and just fresh pasta, wings and pizza that this place offers now i am obligated
Best and most friendly staff and food are highly recommended
Most fresh pizza ingredients in town. just perfect.
Great pizza we use them all the time!

One Bite everyone knows the rules. I went here, originally, because of the high review from Barstool Sports. I go back every week because it is now my favorite pizza joint in all of Brooklyn, and all of NYC for that matter. The name “Best Pizza” always throws my friends off when I tell them about it, until they try it. This spot has truly earned their name in my opinion. Crispy, but perfectly fluffy dough, delicious sauce, and some of the best cheese you will taste on a pizza. The addition of a basil leaf on each slice compliments the pizza on a level you have to experience yourself. You will not be disappointed giving Best Pizza a chance.

Ordered for pickup on seamless last night in the middle of a snowstorm and I completely understand why they’d be closed, but why did you accept my seamless order when you’re completely closed? Then they even had the audacity to charge me in the morning for the pizzas.
Omg is this place good! Best pizza I’ve ever had!

Good pizza if you’re in the area. You might not get the freshest piece if you’re ordering by slice but you can always wait for a new pie to come out. Definitely think the sauce is the best part but a bit expensive for an average nyc slice. Glad I tried it out and might come back if I’m ever in the area again.
Yes - Best Pizza!

UPDATE 1/29/21: Yet again we received a pizza without the ingredients we ordered and paid for.  The pizza is delicious but I honestly can’t continue to literally give my money to a place that consistently doesn’t give me what I paid for.  Will be ordering from Joe’s Pizza from now on.
Definitely some of the best pizza around the city. Grandma slice was exceptional.
Good neopolitan style pizzas! Not too heavy, and very reasonably priced :)
This is my favorite slice place in Brooklyn. Pies are amazing and the staff are super cool
Good but far from the best.
Pizza just happens to be one of my specialties, this place keeps up with the best of em in my book...! ..
Great pizza-- some of the best in NYC at large!  Thin crust and delicious toppings. Highly recommend!
Excellent pizza! Authentic NY pizza in a great little pizza shop!  Small place with great service and greater pizza. Worth traveling to. The dough is fantastic. Great job!
This is the best pizza and anyone who doesn’t like it is a mook.
I came all the way from Poland to have a bite and I wasn't disappointed. The best pizza in NYC in my opinion. There's something incredible about that taste. Also had the chance to meet Frank ;)
Great 👌 everything .

OVERHYPED. UNDERCOOKED. PIZZA IS MEH.. CHOOSE ANOTHER APOT IF YOU WANT A PROPER CRISP NY SLICE AND GOOD SERVICE. ALSO WAITED FOR AN HOUR AND A HALF FOR MY PIZZA. GOD KNOWS HOW IT STILL ARRIVES  HOT.. YEAH.. TRY L’INDUSTRY OR JOES. SO MUCH BETTER.
minus one star for the high card minimum but otherwise good!
Best. Pizza. Enough said.
Nice pizza, dough is fermented and has a nice flavor, cheese is fatty but not too fatty and the place looks cool
One of the best pizzerias in Brooklyn, especially NY. The white pizza is out of this world. Frank and his team are super polite and courteous and it’s always a great time when I stop by.
Indeed the best pizza! It’s not a joke.
Amazingly good pizza

Frank's pizza joint is legitimately among the best pizzerias in Brooklyn, and lives up to its name. The white slice is unique and it's so easy to eat half a pie in one sitting because the crust is just unbelievably airy and light and has the perfect bite. 5 stars all the way
Excellent, attentive service, great location, great prices, and most importantly, amazing food that was fresh and homemade. Very highly recommended. I love it.
It definitely honors its name! One of the best pizza's I've had in NYC, simply delicious. Make sure you're hungry (or have enough companions), the pies are huge.
Great and friendly staff. Enjoyed the veggie and the taste of the white pizza but the white pizza was a little too crispy
Amazing delicious 😋
Honestly the arugula salad is outstanding.
This is the best pizza, especially with their caramelized onions.
Truly lives up to its name
The cheese slice had an excellent crust and good cheese and sauce. Try their signature white pizza as well.
I went on a pizza tour of the best Pizza places in NY and of all the places this was my favorite by a big margin. This is hands down New york's best pizza
(Translated by Google) The pizza is delicious because they make it on charcoal  (Original) Esta rica la pizza porque la hacen en carbon
Best 👍.
LOVE!

Awesome customer service. They make real pizza in real wood oven pizza. Go here if you want real slice of pizza. One of my favorite places in NYC. The pizza feels light when you eat. You can easily eat more slices. The sauce of the pizza is unique to this place. That basil flavor on the regular cheese pizza is just out of this world.
Check these guys out on the internet a picture is worth a thousand words guys! Fantastic fantastic fantastic
I am a pizza fanatic, and they do the NY slice justice!
One of the best pizza spots in Brooklyn!

I had the cheese slice and the "infamous white" slice. I loved the cheese slice. The sauce , cheese and the bread was in perfect harmony. I didn't care much for the white slice. It was a bit sweet for me. With caramelized onions. I did find the sesame seed crust satisfying. The cheese slice is was soo good.. ended up buying a pie.
One of the best if not the best pizza place in New York,NY. Can't wait to make it back to this place again
Got a 80% burnt crust.
Epic
Looking at Best pizza through AUBREE'S WINDOW.
4.5. Great pizza, I can't yet give 5 stars yet. It's not the perfect pizza, but it's an amazing pizza. You will definitely love it though.
Very good pizza!! If your in this part of Brooklyn don't miss it!

Will get pizza there anytime I'm in the neighborhood. My favorite Grandma's slice in the city. Second to none. The sweet yet tangy acidity of the marinara, coupled with the crispy yet chewy dough beneath make for an unforgettable slice. The regular neopolitan pizza is alright, nothing to write home about. Great but not mind blowing.

Best pizza has a solid slice. Definitely way above average for NYC which is, for sure, saying something. If you’re in the area I’d definitely stop by for a slice! The cheese is good and I think another good option is the Grandma’s slice. Also the prices are pretty reasonable, but there is a $10 credit card minimum so keep that in mind.
Staff was moody and lil rude. Pizza is ok. Drove there from other part of Brooklyn just to try their special slice and was disappointed
My favorite pizza joint..
Great NY style pizza, pretty good meatballs. Will be back to try more!
Pizza is super dope but if you want the best chicken parm sandwich you’ve ever had in your life definitely go here. You will not be disappointed!!!
I can't even begin to explain how good the pizza is here.
Im here because of BARSTOOL
Very tasty pizza!
Unique but delicious
Great pizza. A+ pizza
Two thumbs up overalll.
Amazing Owner, Wonderful Pizza
MAKE SURE U TRY THE VEGGIE PIZZA 🍕
This ain’t dollar pizza, but it’s worth it.

Definitely SOME of the best pizza. But there is one place that I go to that nowhere else has ever been able to beat. It's a secret though. I can't expose it. Best Pizza is still some super dank pizza though!
This white slice beats out all the other white slices in the city. It’s worth the trek to this park LD BK to experience perfection!

(Translated by Google) One of the best pizzas of my life! Exactly the same taste as that of my great grandmother but even better (look at my last name) 😂We discovered this address thanks to a pizza tour organized on Airbnb in Brooklyn. Their pizza was the best for me! If I go back to NYC, I run there ... 👌🏻  (Original) L'une des meilleures pizzas de ma vie ! Exactement le même goût que celle de mon arrière grand-mère mais en encore mieux (regardez mon nom de famille) 😂Nous avons découvert cette adresse grâce à un pizza tour organisé sur Airbnb à Brooklyn. Leur pizza était pour moi la meilleure ! Si je retourne à NYC, j'y cours... 👌🏻
So good, my wife asked to go for second slice of the grandma when we were on vacation in Brooklyn. Will definitely go back!

Great crust. Fresh ingredients can’t complain. The basil was a nice touch. No frills pizza joint. Nothing that really stood out to me. There is a credit card minimum. Service from the cashiers is pretty efficient. No complains on the interior.
One of the best slices in the five boroughs
Lives up to the name. Fantastic pizza
Best
Top man Frankie- keep it coming
Great slice.

Went pizza hopping in Williamsburg, Brooklyn on a Friday night and this was the best of three. If you like very crispy and flavorful cheese on your pizza this is the spot! Other great places near the Bedford train station are Vinnie’s and Joe’s (but you can get Joe’s in Manhattan).

Absolutely incredible pizza. Everything about it was great: the cheese, the amount of tomato sauce, the basil on every slice and the amazing crust. One of the best New York style pizza you’ll have. Enjoy  $23 for this cheese pizza.
Very handsome pizza makers
One my favorite places to get NY style pizza. The Grandma slice is excellent as well! Must try if you are in Williamsburg
I try to stop by for a slice every time I'm in the city. Their pizza is really the best!
Very good pizza some of the best I've had very pricey though and not much selection of sodas of beer very very small place good for a date

I order for my office once a week, usually large order sizes for 40+ people. I try to place the order as soon as possible (11:00am) and provide as much notice as possible so the vendor has time to prepare. When I asked if the food could be ready by 12:30pm, the staff laughed in my face. They were extremely rude on the phone. The tone was off, and made me feel like they were doing me a favor by picking up the phone. The pizza is good.
The staff is super friendly and the food smells delicious!
I certainly liked the food and customer service, good location nearby to my house. The cashiers are always super friendly. I highly recommend this place.
Do your self a favor skip the cheese and pepperoni go straight for the white slice.
Excellent pizza Williamsburg
The name says it all!
The name says it all.
some of the best pizza ive ever had
Classic NY style pizza done well
Best pizza means one of the Best Pizza joint's in New York. Highly recommend this place for all the pizza lovers!
,great pizza
Best slice in NYC.
Get the white slice with carmelized onions.

A decade of perfection at Best Pizza. When I first saw sign for Best Pizza when it opened, I shook my head at the arrogance. I didn't even give it a chance for months. That was a huge mistake. Still young compared to the pizza royalty of New York, but now is surely one of it's kings. It has become my favorite slice shop for sure. Most times there are about three fresh pies. It's usually the white pie, a cheese pie, pepperoni, and/or a square grandma pie. I was never really a white slice sort of guy but here it's a must. The white pie covered in creamy ricotta cheese, salty pecorino cheese, and caramelized onions. The onions are sweet, tender and delicious. I think there is a hint of lemon on the slice which adds a nice brightness but not positive. Regardless of the added acids existence, try a white slice. The pepperoni slice is my other favorite. I have been coming here the last decade and hope they are opened for many more so I can continue to enjoy great, I mean Best Pizza.

pizza is good but unfortunately the staff is pretty rude. I live down the street and have been here numerous times and have had the same experience with staff every time. they don't ever say please or thank you...EVER. i am usually here with my roommate and he has said the same thing. if it weren't for good pizza i would never go here due to the lack of respect and manners the staff exhibit. it's a shame that customer service isn't a thing anymore.
The name says it all

had the cheese with pepperoni it was really good definitely  recommend  trying it out if your in the area. Also there paper plate artwork they have on the walls is really cool something  to check out when your there.
It was the best
Great pizza great staff it get super packed, take that as a good thing and recommend ordering to go unless you dont mind waiting long for a table
If you're going to name a place Best Pizza you've got a big reputation to fill. I'd give it five stars if it were called Fine Pizza.
Lived up to its name

Man, I was so sad about this. Always dreamed of visiting. For whatever reason, on our night, the chef (a little guy) burned the cheese on the pizza so that it dried and bubbled. Meanwhile, a black crust is good, but the whole slice was charred to smithereens. I’m sure it’s just that we had a bad night. Perhaps avoid when the small fella is by the ovens as he chats a lot and doesn’t keep an eye on it. Will be back, but by far not the best pizza I’ve had. Not even close. (Staff were friendly FYI)
We got a few pies they were real good I wish we lived there we’d have it all the time
Great staff and very tasty pizza. Highly recommend
The name says it all. If you want a fresh, bright, thin and crisp pie look no further. The crust is perfect...the sauce is light....the cheese is real. Delish.
Gotta get the Grandma slice
Good pizza

I went there for the first time last Monday............the pizza is very good! BUT, the place needs to be renovated a little bit. I think the owner is going for the old grungy look, but for an eatery, the ambiance is the first step in your experience. I went all the way from Howard Beach to try it, and when I walked in I was scared to try the pizza, because the place was a bit dingy and the weird people from other states with their 70's clothes purposely trying to look frumpy and no personality stares, yikes. W E I R D O S. But, the pizza was very good. The worker's are not helpful, you don't know who to order from, you don't know when to pick it up at the counter. I know the neighborhood is the hipster, grungy dirty look , paying $4,000 for a 1 bedroom apartment that used to be used as a crack house, and you all pushed out the people that lived there.... BUT renovate that space a bit and get nice tables and matching new chairs. Again the Pizza was delicious, I had the grandma.

I’m not sure if this place has the BEST pizza but it certainly has impressive pizza. Would I commute to this area just for their pizza? No. But it’s worth trying if you’re in the area. Prices were okay. Sorta pricey like many other pizza places in NY. I especially like their white pizza. It’s not too cheesy or congested like other white pizzas I’ve had. The space is very cute. There were cute children paper plate drawings on the walls and more than enough seating.
Lovely little place! Traveled here from Arlington, Virginia and the staff were really friendly and the pizza was amazing! Coming here again for sure!
white pizza on smash

Impossibly crisp and thin base with piping hot stretchy melted cheese. Good amount of grease and balance between the natural sweetness of the sauce and saltiness of the cheese. This is one of the best renditions of a true New York slice.
I'm miss this place so much

Right amount of grease and perfect texture. Wonderful neo- Neapolitan/ NY slice style and crust with a grandmas that’s closer to a sicilian. Not as much flavor as a Di Fara or Rubirosa but a top 12 option in NYC

Was really looking forward to trying Best Pizza. I’m sure if you’ve done you’re research you know it’s gotten very high remarks from various write ups and personally I love a story like the owner, Frank, bringing his passion, knowledge and family recipes into the area he grew up in.  When you first walk-in, the vibe and atmosphere are upbeat yet the old school menu boards and small ordering window with the pizza cookin right behind transport you back to za spots from the 90’s. Instant smile factor for me. Interior, nailed it.  But man was the pizza lackluster. We were sadly disappointed in the dull flavors in the sauce and cheeses. For context, we went on a Friday night at 8:30pm, not overwhelmingly busy, got a table and ate in. (I’m bummed writing this because I want to support restaurant owners like Frank, but this is just my take on our visit, I hope you try and then make your own opinion!)  Should’ve taken photos, but we ordered a slice of pepperoni, cheese and grandma’s. I appreciate a crispy crust, but the grandma slice was so crispy it reminded me of eating an over toasted bruschetta. Everything just seemed over cooked, even the cheese pizza. The pepperoni we felt could have had a few more pepperoni and again, veryy crispy and not much chew to the dough. But that’s how all the pizzas looked that were coming out, as well as the pizzas sitting in the case?  Maybe we went on an off night or they had a new pizza chef. Not sure, but sadly with an average price of 4.50 a slice, there are too many other pizza spots in New York to try to be enticed to go back to Best Pizza :(
Dammm good white slice!!
Not clean 😖

Tried some stuff tonight and was kinda underwhelmed. Maybe it’s just a tough scene for NYC pizza, but I’ve had better, not sure what the hype was about. The crust was super dry and crunchy on the edges, felt a little like cardboard in the middle. And it didn’t taste like anything.  The toppings were good, but the veggie pizza had beets and squash and cauliflower and I think potatoes? That was the least favorite thing I ate. The garlic knots were rather good though.
Best pizza I’ve had in New York, hands down. The atmosphere is really cool, and the pizza is exceptional. The crust on the grandma is incredible.  Will be back often.

The grandma slice and the cheese slice hit the spot they are perfection on a plate. Now the reason for a 4 star and not a 5 the white slice I understand how pot cheese (ricotta) is made but I believe this batch had way to much acid added because it tasted like I was eating a pizza covered in lemon juice. This could be a one time thing or it could be the recipe which hey I understand bring in the acid to brighten the slice and cut through the richness of ricotta. Overall I will continue to get grandma slices from here for the foreseeable future also do your self a favor and look at all the plate art it is great.
Best pizza
Amazing!!!!
Like the name says, it really is the best pizza in Brooklyn.
Lives up to the name.  Great fresh ingredients handled well and presented with the intention of enjoying right away!

Truly is the best NY pizza I've had. I never understood the hype behind NY style pizza. I tried the pepperoni and grandma. Pepperoni had basil on it. Nice touch. Good tomato sauce and crunch on the dough. I liked grandma more, which was square shaped. Really great flavor and nice crisp.  Only downside for me was the price. $4.50 a slice. But that's expected since I'm from TX. I would order a whole pie.
Omg!!! Loved it, the crust was amazing!
5star pizza!!!  😋😋😋😋😋
(Translated by Google) Nice pizza!  (Original) Nice pizza!
Historic pizzaria
Cool place with the music and $6 wine pours. Pizza is mediocre and overpriced.
The name says it all. You have to try it.
Really great pizza and quick service! Music was great too.
Chill atmosphere, awesome music, great pizza, fast service. What's not to like?
It was ok, but not so much more. I´ve had better pizza in NYC.
Solid set of pizzas for affordable price. Seating doesn’t provide for larger groups but you can always have it to go.
It’s called the best for a reason it’s truly best...
Awesome stone oven fire pizza. Little expensive though. Take off 1 star because you guys are too expensive. Sure it's great; but it's only damn dough with sauce. Comeon.
One of the best slices in the city. 5 stars for gluten free pizza by the slice! A little pricey but you get what you pay for. Make the trip and enjoy the experience.
Dope spot to catch a slice. The seasonal veggie slice and pepperoni are usually my choices.
They delivered cold pizza and a salad with no forks
Overrated. It was ok, but there it's better pizza in Williamsburg for certain.
Pizza is pretty good!
Unfortunately not. Wasn’t the best but wasn’t the worst
(Translated by Google) Delicious pizza  (Original) Deliciosa Pizza
Great spot for a New York slice with upscale ingredients; awesome vibes and artwork inside
Pizza is amazing and prices aren't that expensive!!
I did not like this place at all.  If you're gonna called yourself Best Pizza then I would assume you have one of the best slices around. Not the case.
I only tried the grandma pizza, so I cannot comment on the regular slices.  It was like having a pizza from Costco, but for 30$. It was overly doughy and greasy.

(Translated by Google) Very good pizza at a reasonable price, in the middle of nowhere in Brooklyn. Sale on the spot or take away. Many paper plates are decorated by customers.  (Original) Très bonnes pizza à un prix raisonnable, au milieu de nul part dans Brooklyn. Vente sur place ou à emporter. Ne nombreuses assiettes en carton sont décorées par les clients.
Amazing.
Elevated NY slice, soul warming grandma style pie, all around solid pizza spot.
Great place for a late night slice!  Their pizza dough has great flavor and a subtle chew to it.  The staff is very friendly and even played my friends song request on their bluetooth Bose speaker!
Great pizza place!!! always fresh and cheesy.
Don't call it pizza
Love Best Pizza!!  The best white pie I've ever had!  Nicest staff!  The owner, Frank, is the sweetest guy!  My family tried all their pizzas and everything is delicious!!
Was visiting NYC from Australia and came to Best Pizza because of Frank. The pizza completely exceeded my high expectations, it truly was the perfect slice.

Great product - but every time I come here the guy behind the counter tries to overcharge me 10.50 for two slices - which are 3.75. Very friendly. Maybe Frank’s YouTube vids got demonetized and he needs the extra dough.
Stool Presidente doesn't know pizza

Love the Pizza show series but the pizza didn't impress me. Overcooked, overpriced, and underflavored. I had high hopes for this place I drove all the way from Westchester County, but boy I was disappointed. My pizza was nice and crunchy but was burnt. The ingredients (sauce or cheese) didn't wow me like at Joe's Pizza, or Patsy's. I still need to try out Lucaris, Lombardi's, and Nonnas in Coney Island. I hate to say this, but maybe you should take the word "best" off the sign. 2 plain burnt cheese slices ran me $7.50. I had better pizza for cheaper and closer to home (I.e. Pelham Pizza in Pelham, NY) La Rosa pizza is even closer (New Rochelle) to me but I won't waste my time going now 👎
Good pizza not the best tho

A great hole-in-the-wall pizza joint. The place reminded me of something you would see in an old mob movie. It’s a little rundown but by no means dirty. The pizza was excellent and the staff was great. If you want a good no nonsense slice be sure to stop in.  Super thin and crispy crust. If anything maybe a little dry.
Best pizza is cash money the quintessential NY slice spot beer was cold pizza was hot nuff said fam
Great Ny slice. Reccomend the cheese and white
Slices are good, but just ordered a large cheese pie, and it was one of the worst pizzas I’ve ever had. Not sure what happened on this order, but couldn’t be more unsatisfied. $23 down the drain.
I stop by for a regular and mushroom slice. Sauce is amazing and it fills me up!!
Went to Di Fara first.  Big mistake.  Di Fara has gone down hill and way over priced.  Best Pizza was excellent and priced well.  Delicious crust.  Some of the best pizza I have ever had.
Good slice but not as good as I was hoping. I had really high expectations for this slice and I was let down. Maybe it was an off night? It still give it another chance though.

I had really really high hopes for this place. Like many, found out about it watching Frank on the Pizza Show - he seems like a really great guy and wanted to try out his pizza. I ordered a white pie for my coworkers at the office, and while I was waiting for it I had them heat me up a cheese slice. The cheese slice was notably under-cheesed and over-sauced, but I have to say the dough was spectacular. My white pie came out pretty quick, and headed back to the office. It wasn't until I got back and opened up the box that I realized they put onions on their white pie. As someone who has eaten a lot of pizza, I can't say I've ever seen that. A third of my co-workers loved the white pie, another third were "meh" about it, and the last third (myself included) didn't even eat more than a few bites because we just don't like onions, especially on our pizza.
Original and White pizza are the way to go! A slice of each and you will not be disappointed.

This will have been my second time hitting up best pizza, my first time was with my brother. This time a friend was in town and we walked here from grimm brewery. I went for the cheese and grandma slice. Both worth it, grandma showcased a well done red sauce  the bottom was crispy enough without being spotted. Cheese was spotted and crispy just like a classic nice crunch , no flop. Sleeper menu item ? Garlic knots , you get some heat from the garlic, and it's topped with finely grated cheese, comes with a red sauce.

Frank! I would not say that this is the worst pizza. But for the name "Best Pizza" - your pizza is the worst. The worst. Very bad dough, bad ingredients, bad technique. Everything is bad! Why are you not so objective about yourself? Through which filter do you look at yourself and your skills? Why did you go to Italy and talk with legendary chefs? Such a shame. How could you not remember anything? Where is your passion and thirst for knowledge? Why are you even doing this?
Great tasting pizzas at affordable prices
Friendly staff

After watching Frank and the pizza show, I've been meaning to get here on my last few trips to NY. I tried the pepperoni slice and it was decent but could have been hotter. $5 for an actual pint of bud (good value) , not those small glasses they usually have in the US.  Nice venue and the pies I saw coming out looked good. Only had a few better slices in the city.
Really good!
Delicious pizza in Brooklyn! Go for the white pizza it's way too dope!🤙🏽
It was delicious!!!
Legendary pizza. Get the pepperoni
So delicious - best gluten free crust!
It's the Best.
Not the Best. It's ok.
Fantastic pizza! Went in for one slice ended up having 3!
Almost the best pizza I say
Excellent pizza. The veggie was one of the best I've ever had!
Fantastic
If i bad to rate. Id give it a 8.7
Never disappoints.... simply the Best.
Very nice. Almost best pizza! Definitely best in Williamsburg.
The name says it all.
Very nice pizza. Quick and efficient service. Even the vegetarian one was excellent. Definitely one to return to.
Truly the best pizza!
Authentic
Margarita Sicilian
Best pizza is certainly not the best pizza, I've tried better ones. But is good,  the veggie one surprised me.

Came here with my husband on our wedding night before heading back to our Airbnb to "sleep" ;) Our son recommended this place to us after watching YouTube videos about it. We promised him we'd go and bring him back a couple slices. Didn't take much convincing as the idea of pizza and Presidente beers on our wedding night is literally perfection in our opinion. Pizza is very good. Fresh ingredients and friendly service. Crust does harden quick though and doesn't heat back up really well. But service was quick and friendly and pizza was pretty good. We'd def go back and bring our boy next time.
Awesome fresh pizza. Has a great taste. Definitely a tourist destination.  We will be back.
Why are you not trusting the name? They don't let you call it best pizza unless it's literally the best pizza
Always a great slice. Grandma slice. My favorite here.
(Translated by Google) Excellent 🔥  (Original) Excelente 🔥
I'd give it three but for $4 a slice the bar is higher.
Literally the best pizza I've ever had😂😂
One of the best (no pun) pizzas in NYC. It’s in the same weight class as DiFara, Lucali, and John’s (on Bleecker).
Was really good, but my slice may have been overcooked a bit and was all crunch and no chew. I will need to try it again.
Excellent place to eat some food when in a hurry. Their customer service is quick, rates are affordable, good vibes. Would recommend to others
Definitely one of the best pizza places in New York. Although, it's very good an cheap, it is just slightly overrated.
The name says it all
Excellent pizza, great sauce, awesome balance of ingredients.
Best pizza is aptly named- best pizza in the area. Recommend the white slice!
Great cheese slices. Meatball side was also really good!
Came on my first day in NYC and had to come back on my last day because the grandma slice is truly the best pizza of my trip!
Excellent pepperoni slice and grandma pizza.
The name speaks for itself
This is easily the finest pizza in North Brooklyn, maybe the borough.  I Stay with the classic slice, but anything off the menu is excellent.  Don't change Frankie.
Solid pizza that is very satisfying.  The cheese, sauce, and crust all come together to make a delicious and well worth it NY slice to try.
Great stuff. Crispy and chewy crust.

Sorry guys! I took 2 bites and put it down! I came from astoria to your pizzeria after watching the boss on his show. The pizza was soggy and was not good. I’m not sure if the pizza was sitting and they thought it was hot enough. I was expecting the Barstool 9.1 pizza worth traveling for but I was disappointed.

The crust and basil was on point and the only reason why it even got two stars. However, like another reviewer said there was virtually no sauce on the pizza, it made the slice super bland. I believe during off hours they have staff who don't keep the quality consistent. I hope in the future it improves.
Lives up to its name as some of the best pizza in Brooklyn as far as slices go.  Good service along with good, freshly baked pizzas!
Get the grandma slice

Best pizza I ever had, absolutely delicious, had seen Franks tv show and wanted to sample some for myself so grabbed a couple of slices, glad I did. I recommend the Grandma pizza in particular. Staff were very helpful and polite and the restaurant was clean and welcoming.
Expensive (3.75 a dlice) for mediocre pizza
Frank runs an amazing shop, the pizza was amazing.
Grandma veggie was amazing

Walked in and firstly felt the beat of the rap music. The atmosphere and decor has a rustic feel to it, like trying without really trying. Got both a grandma and a regular slice. Regular was good, but a bit outside of the norm for a NY slice. The slice was thin with a good amount of sauce. The Square grandma was amazing. Pizza was actually a bit flaky and the sauce was on point. NY staple, MUST TRY. Will Definitely come again. 8/10
The Best Pizza! Gotta love Frank. Much love from Germany
We come all the way from St.Louis and we love it. Definitely it is the best pizza 😍.
A good 4.5 slice of pizza, not quite a total 5 star but it was very good.
Very simple using good quality ingredients. They pay very high attention to the limited menu they serve. Very good pizza.
Truly the best pizza i had during my week long trip to NYC. It's the only place we went to twice.  Frank, please come open a shop in New Orleans. We desperately need it.
Very good cheese and toppings are top quality. Crust is standard New York City quality.
Lives up to its name and the hype. Recommend the white if you want to try something interesting otherwise you can't go wrong with the classic pepperoni. Laid back cool atmosphere and good food.
Real NY pizza. Thank you, loved their pizza. The best I've had in years.

I feel like this place used to be good. Something happened in the last 5 years, because it’s not good now. A below-average NY slice. Definitely needs more sauce. I imagine a lot of people would want more cheese. Just disappointing, honestly. A decent crust with good “old-oven” taste can’t rescue it.
Crust was burned(charred) and lite on the ingredients.
Worst service ever!!!! You place an order and they bring the wrong one. Then they want to argue with you and say that you’re wrong. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY THERE
Delicious slices - try the white one!!  It is so good I almost fell off my chair
Stupid good pizza. Cool little spot. The white pizza and the chicken parm are worth driving into Brooklyn during rush hour.
Best pizza is the real deal there is no doubt about it.
Not as good as they used to be...
Hands Down Best pizza (TheNameSaysItAll)

Excellent crust with high quality ingredients. The crust is next level here, people. Versus the typical NYC pizza, this is artisan bread making. You want to get their white pizza that has caramelized onions and a sesame seeds on the crust as well as their seasonal veggie pizza!
I had the white slice and the veggie.  Both were great but the veggie was just amazing.
Nice solid pizza, the base is good bread but a bit chewy as you get the the edge.  Not the ‘Best Pizza’ in Brooklyn, but a solid contender.
Pizza was awesome
Came here after I saw the Frank Pinello YouTube videos. It was amazing, the proportions are spot-on here. Right amount of everything.
Top pizza, tastes really good!
good pizza & the playlist always fire 👌🏾🤷🏾‍♀️.
Great pizza and rest of the menu looked just as good.
These pies are so delicious!
High quality pizza! Fast service and friendly. Pizzas are priced well for the size of the pie. Highly recommend!
(Translated by Google) Very small!  (Original) Muy chiquito !
The name is apt. #1 grandma slice in town fo sho...

Brooklyn is haven for a variety of quality pizza spots that have unique styles. Best Pizza definitely goes above and beyond to make an incredibly vivid slice of pizza. Lots of flavors coming at you; will rank highly amongst your BK pizza list 🏆
Best pizza by name...  Try the garlic knots!
Awesome pizza well deserving of the name!
The best slice in Williamsburg.
The says it all, el presidenty gave it a 9.1 and it has lived up to that rep
Wonderful things crust well done za.. semi burnt. Dough bubbles, very consistent.. Grandma is just as tasty with a few more carbs
Great pizza. Highly recommended. Mostly a takeout though.
(Translated by Google) Delicious pizza  (Original) Heerlijke pizza
In the top 5 pizzerias in Nyc in my opinion.
Pizza is delicious, love the grandma slice. Meatballs are legit as well
The name says it all, this is one of the best pizzas in brooklyn hands down!

Pizza was absolutely perfect.  I know the grandma and the white slice are highly recommended, but for purposes of a consistent rating I went with the cheese slice.  It was amazing. Perfect amount of cheese, just the right amount of crisp/crunch to the crust. Pleasant basil aroma. Wonderful sauce.  Would have no problem eating this pizza every day. Can't wait to stop again next trip to New York!

Literally the best NYC Pie & Slice shop I've ever had. Brooklyn pizza > Manhattan.  Also, the best sandwiches one can find. Traditional hoagie, or hero, meets rustic panino Italiano. Cento percento il ottimo.
Truth in advertising. This is the best pizza in the neighborhood. Original and delicious. Forget all the other famous joints. This is the one you should visit.
It's a small pizza place and it gets packed. I guess it's pretty popular. The pizza was great, but the meatballs were the real star here.
Great pizza. Pepperoni and sausage.
Classic NY pizza
Pizarro thin crust taste wonderful  will go there again
Very good Pizza but expensive for a regular slice
The best slice in Williamsburg.
Great draft beer in here!
Get it. Get it now!
Is it the best pizza? No. Is it really really good pizza? Yes. Don’t order delivery. Eat there for maximum enjoyment.
2.5 Hours delivery wait time , dont waste your time !!!!!!!!! Bad customer service
Did the trick.  Would certainly go back.
(Translated by Google) Exquisite  (Original) Exquisita
This is amazing place to have a yummy pizza. Whenever I go to NY, I visit this place.
The name says I all.
Honestly not very good. Bland.
The white pizza loved it

very crowded    seats 10 people very small counter poor set up to work with traffic flow     but hey its in a 12x12 room    no locals dare enter  its a tourist shop  squares nice and tasty BUTT   i'll got to elseware   for  a 4 $ slice

Just as it's name implies, Best Pizza is one of the best pizza places in all of Brooklyn. Frank's take on a white pizza, with delicious caramelized onions and fresh cheese, is the thing to try! You'd be seriously missing out if you don't at least grab a grandma slice and give this place a shot.
Nice fast food to go and grab really tasty slide of pizza!
Get the grandma slice and it will change your life
Friend had been telling us about this place for a while and we finally decided to go. Amazing pizza at great prices. The garlic knots are bomb. Great service and quick turnout.

Authentic place to get one of the best Brooklyn pizzas. Made fresh just for you, cute atmosphere with paper plates serving as artwork. Can't go wrong with the white pizza, sesame seed crust was a pleasant surprise.
White cheese slice with caramelized onions is one of the great slices of pizza in New York City! Worth traveling from other continents, planets or dimensions for their pizza.

Being such a huge fan of Frank and his media explosion, I was quite disappointed with the pizza at "BEST Pizza". The dough in our pies were undercooked to the point where few slices were inedible.  Orders were also forgotten and mixed. That is somewhat understandable given the busy timing, however not entirely acceptable.

Being going there since it opened. The PIZZA  is on point. Old school Brooklyn pizza for sure. Plus a lot of cool new style slices .Frankie the owner is amazing. Plus a CIA grad. Really good customer service. No attuide like you get a Paulie Gees slice shop. In fact I wish Frankie would run Paulie's slice shop .
Phenomenal slice, you won't be disappointed.
Really good pizza came all the way from Miami to have me a slice. Employees were nice and helpful, even came to check on us.

The pizza was bland and gave us toilet problems 💩😬!  I'm from London and was dragged here by my bf who is a big fan of Frank and the pizza show. Unfortunately the hype didn't live up to its name. We ordered a margarita to share and it was bland. I added chilli oil and parmesan in an attempt to flavour some slices but this didn't help either. That evening me and my bf both had toilet problems and I believe it was from the pizza as that was the only meal we both shared that day. My bf being a excited fan girl still believes this was a good pizza and gave a generous tip despite the lack of flavour. All that being said the service was good.
Literally the best pizza in Williamsburg
First time here..just a good ol pizzaria..nothing fancy..but nice slices and squares..and cool customer art on the walls..I dug it
Authentic NY pizza, added to our New York experience, decent beer and wine selection too.
We were staying in Manhatten and had to go back for seconds it was that good
Frank's place makes good stuff
Great pizza
Vice brought me here. Frank Pinello runs a dope shop. Ate 5 slices and the meatballs. And bought a tee. Best Pizza in Brooklyn.

It’s in the name! I’ve lived in NY my whole life, and they have one of the best pizza lies I’ve ever tasted. Even have gluten free! All of the ingredients are super fresh! Just may take a while if you’re ordering pies.
Any place that has Best in it's name is generally far from it. This place is most definitely an exception to that rule. Probably top 5 pizzas i had in my life
Really good pizza great staff
Always a great late night stop on the way home

I was excited to try this pizza put I genuinely thought it was going to be great. I waited 40 minutes and came all the way from South Brooklyn and I was very disappointed. The cheese and sauce was very bland and generic. It felt like I was …
Grandma slice and full white pie was amazing! The caramelized onions are a great savory twist
It's not called BEST PIZZA for no reason!! Slice of Grandmas
My favorite spot in Brooklyn. Was a fool & never ordered the garlic knots, then a friends had me try one & my tiny animal brain combusted.
Friendly staff and great atmosphere. You gotta try the white pizza!
The name says it all. Great white slice. Great grandma slice.
Fantastic food. And amazing ambiance. Cesar is a great manager and the team always makes you feel welcome. A great addition to the neighborhood.
May noy be "the best pizza" ive ever had but it was darn good.

If we're going on a barstool sports score, this place gets a 9.1, which rounds up to 5 stars on Google! Quintessential NY pizza joint, friendly employees and settled into the neighborhood so well I nearly walked right past it.
Hands down best pizza in town. Difaras 2/5, joes pizza 4/5, artichoke 3/5, industry pizza 4/5. Best pizza 5/5!!
Best Pizza? 🤣
(Translated by Google) Incredibly delicious 👏 Worth the price and detour 👍  (Original) Incroyablement délicieux 👏 Mérite le prix et le détour 👍
(Translated by Google) The white pizza with goat cheese and lime zest is highly recommended!  (Original) De witte pizza met geitenkaas en zeste van limoen is een echte aanrader!
My favorite is the veggie slice, but can't go wrong with anything here

Best's White Pizza might actually be the best White slice in Brooklyn! Sesame crust, carmelized onions, and a hint of lemon imo are the success of this pie! Sometimes there is a wait but its worth it! Tonight there was a Drake sing-a-long! ❤❤❤

We went because my friend had seen an episode of some show about Frank Pinello, and were hoping for it to be really good. Don't get me wrong, it's still good pizza, but we went in with maybe really high hopes and were slightly disappointed. But overall it's inexpensive and good to get on the go
Still the best pizza in Williamsburg
Try anything with their tomato sauce
This restaurants is the best restaurants in my book, i had hired the best pizza in my life.But overall, it was a great move which is why I still give it four stars.Thank You!!

Definitely 5 stars, white slice is the best pizza i ever had period! Cheese and square pizza are amazing also, top 4 pizza places in the US, store amazingly able to recreate "Old School pizza experience" lol For Better or Worse...
The best

It has been my first bad customer experience in a restaurant in a while! They took a lot of time to make our pizza, when it was finally ready the waiter just threw the plates on the table, completely rude and unacceptable! Our pizza was soggy and too greasy. Having so many pizza options in the area for a better taste and price I won't never come back

Curious to try this place after seeing the owner on a Vicelamd pizza show. When I stopped in before a hair appointment in the Neghboor, I wasn’t greeted and ordered a one slice of pepperoni pizza with a can of coke. The place doesn’t have ice, since i had asked for a cup with ice, the cashier said they do not have ice. They take ur name and call you when ur order is ready. The slice had only 2 pieces of pepperoni, with the crust burnt... it tasted very salty and I didn’t enjoyed it as I anticipated. 🙁
Really good. I wish NYC had more miller products but overall excellent pie
Delicious, thanks Frank!
Very good pizza. Simple  and straight to the point.

Don't let the name fool you--this was definitely not the best pizza I've ever had, nor the best in Williamsburg, either. The number of people in the pizzeria made it impossible to stand in the space, let alone find a place to sit. I was in a large group and there were definitely people who came after us who were served before us. I did not time how long we were there, but we definitely spent at least 25 minutes waiting. The pizza was lackluster. Not worth the inconvenience.
(Translated by Google) Very good pizza! I heartily recommend visiting this place!  (Original) Bardzo dobra pizza! Serdecznie polecam odwiedzić to miejsce!
Ordered a white pizza and a meatball hero. The hero was mediocre but the white pizza was great. Sautéed onions and sesame seeds made this an untraditional but special white pie.
This place has the best pizza
(Translated by Google) best dhabha in Mohali  (Original) best dhabha in Mohali

I heard this was one of the best slices in Brooklyn and it really is. The cheese or pepperoni slices were solid with a bit more chewy crust and cheese that gave a stretch. The white is something else entirely and would recommend getting if you're feeling adventurous.

Excellent plain slice, pepperoni, and white slice. Some of the best I've had and i grew up in Brooklyn. They serve beer and wine, will definitely come back to check it the rest of the options... Garlic knots, meatballs and spicy pickle salad all looked delicious. Very friendly staff but the place is quite busy.

Delicious Pizza. Big fan of the pizza show. This guy knows his pizza! The place was difficult to find using google maps. Probably would have never got the chance to eat here if I didnt see the show, Actually bumped into him when I visited. Original decor from when the business was established. Great atmosphere and best of all best pizza in Brooklyn by far. Definitely will return.
Is it the best pizza? Maybe. It’s certainly up there.

This is the most well cheesed...golden crusted... richly sauced... flavorful slice I've had in a long time. There isn't much oil. The basil is light, but well done, and the vibe here is very chilled out. A definite must-have if you're in the area. Grab a slice while the L still runs!!
The best place and best pizza
Decent crust, would've been nice if they could've heated my slice. I understand it was a hot day though. Might be the most flavorful crust I've had.
The pizza is amazing, try the white slice!
Pie  is tàsty and flavorfully
Best pizza in town.

I had the cheese slice and it was awesome! The crust was crispy and not chewy, the cheese was gooey and the sauce isn't sweet so that's a plus!  Having the name Best Pizza is audacious but the slice I had lived up to that name.  The staff …
This is,  no pun intended,  the best pizza in Brooklyn.  If you like New York pizza,  this is your place!
yo. bomb. the best.
Actually the Best Pizza I have ever had. One of my fav joints while visiting New York. Every time I was in Williamsburg I had to stop by. All the slices where epic!!
Living up to the name for some fine NYC pizza. Must stop in Brooklyn/Williamsburg for sure.
Excellent pizza! I would recommend ANY of their pies!
Truly lives up to the name!

My husband and I saw the owner on TV he was talking about the best pizza in New York so we decided to check out his place. We had the pleasure of meeting Frank the owner. He was such a cool guy. Omg I'm in thin crust heaven!! We got the white and cheese pie!! The Carmelized onion, ricotta and fresh parmesan cheese is like no other white pizza I've ever eaten. Frank -Pete and Sue will be loyal customers.
Frank P makes it the right way
Mediocre pizza, how can you mess it up? Best pizza should be expensive pizza not worth going to. Not going back to best pizza. The space inside is nice though.
Great pizza!
Friendly people, nice place to sit down and eat a good slice.
They serve fresh. Also a slice is pretty large but light
great experience to who loves pizza! clean and fresh! would recommend!
Awesome pizza
They aren't lying when they say best pizza
Love the way they make pizza in old brick oven. Great service.
Pizza is okay, it is way too overpriced (plain pizza ~4, toping 4-5 bucks). I guess that is what you get for buying Pizza in Williams burg.

GREAT Pizza!! Saw this place advertised on social media somewhere and decided I had to check it out . Had a white slice with caramelized onions on it and it was even better than I had imagined as well as a regular slice. I’m a BIG pizza lover and man this place is a must do !
It was pretty good
Best white slice in the game
Came here cos of the pizza show, all the way from Northern Ireland. Best trip ever, lived it.
Get a grandma pizza, never tasted anything like it. Superb!
Small Joint Good Pizza!
Not my favorite
Good pizza great crust!
That was a pretty mean slice the chicken parmesan sandwich is great
Farewell
This is my new standard for gluten free pizza. Ive been several places that make a good thin GF crust, but few places can pull off a thicker GF crust. Well done Best Pizza!!
All it's cracked up to be

Great pizza especially the white slice, but $10 minimum is annoying for a pizza place. Their atm was broken and they sent me a block over to use a Bodega atm which was also broken. So they finally relented to let me use a card. Come on people, it's 2018, stop the BS card minimums.
First thought after the first bite...Dammmnnn!!!💣
